decision_conditions: The applicant has failed to demonstrate through the submission of cogent evidence that the proposed vehicular crossover would not harm the health and longevity of the immediately adjacent street trees, which would have an unacceptable adverse impact on the quality of the public realm within Beechcroft Avenue and the character and appearance of the street and the wider area, thereby conflicting with Paragraph 131 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy 2012, Policy G7 of the London Plan 2021 and guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD 2013.

The proposed crossover would exceed the recommended width of 4m in conflict with Policies DM9 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy, the Council's Sustainable Transport SPD 2013 and the Council's Crossover Policy 2020.
description: Erection of front dwarf wall, alteration to driveway and new drop kerb including permeable paving, bin and bike storage
